page.title: 02Farming in Ringstead.
page.content: Ringstead was not mentioned in the Domesday Book of 1086,but it is known from archaeological findings that there was a Roman settlement in Mallows Cotton to the S.W.of the present village.Remains of hamlets have been found to the S.W.of Ringstead and these were the homes and animal shelters of people of Mediaeval times.Until recently agriculture has played an important part in the lives of the villagers.In 1869 it was reported that wheat,barley,turnips and roots were the main crops and that the meadow lands provided good grass for grazing.With the coming of the machine age fewer men have been employed on the farms and instead of work on the farm being one of the most important forms of employment it is now one of the least.
